message: I've never really had this problem before, but lately I've been involved in discussions on a few forums around the web. And I find that I don't always notice when people reply or keep posting on the topics. Not just forums, but blog post comments etc. Is there any software that helps keeping track of the discussions you're part of on the web?
@javelinapps we need to get the discussions and forums to use convore as then they are easy to keep track of.
Most forums and blogs have features that allow you to subscribe to any new updates via email.

One attempt at solving this problem is Disqus, which has gotten pretty successful at getting folks to leverage it for comments on blogs/sites, and which is then able to give you a central "profile" and such. I don't comment a ton so I don't recall if Disqus has a "RSS for all my discussions", but they probably do, or could add one sometime if they found value in it.
@javelinapps It's a hard problem because, well, every website is run by different people -- all using different tools, and with different intended use cases for their users
@bitprophet Disqus will notify you if someone replies to one of your comments, I know that for sure.
Getting all sites to use something like Disqus is a bit hard. Maybe there's room for making a piece of software for this...
@javelinapps same problem will apply for _that_ piece of software
@d0ugal aaah ic... correct me if i'm wrong, but isn't awhile back google reader allow you to "track" some if a page is changed?
@unwrangle I think @javelinapps is suggesting something that tracks a website for updates
i.e. you add the site to track - thus it wont need everybody to use it
Yeah, I remember that - never tried it though
That might just do the trick, thanks @unwrangle
